conclusion: Shadows are formed when an object blocks light; shape and size depend on object shape and light source position.
Closer light source results in larger, more elongated shadows; farther light source results in smaller, less elongated shadows.

Increased distance decreases angle of light rays, resulting in smaller, less elongated shadows.

Shadows will become smaller as light source moves backward due to more parallel light rays reducing shadow spread.
